text: Continue onward and explore Castrum Kremnos

title: Mission Description
content: (Trailblazer),Phainon, and Mydei arrive at Castrum Kremnos. What was once a fierce city filled with the clamor of armaments has become a haunting ruin. Deep within this mobile fortress lies the maddened and fallenNikador.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's quieter than I expected...

speaker: Mydei
line: It's corrupted... but still familiar.

speaker: Mydei
line: This is Castrum Kremnos.

speaker: Phainon
line: Times really have changed. Even Nikador's own lands are on the verge of collapse. I haven't seen any sign of Titankin.

speaker: Mydei
line: If even half of Castrum Kremnos' old might remains, it would mean that Aglaea sent us to our deaths.

speaker: Mydei
line: This is the outer city corridor. It used to be heavily guarded by soldiers. Even with the two of us working together, we wouldn't have made it past thirty steps.

text: What if you added me to the count?
Is seeing all this making you homesick?

speaker: Mydei
line: Think whatever you want.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yeah, Kremnos used to be the place every warrior longed for.

speaker: Phainon
line: Kind of a shame you didn't live in that era full of strong warriors , eh Mydei? If all the heroes of the past hadn't fallen one after another, I wouldn't be the only worthy opponent you have left.

speaker: Mydei
line: Are you scared? It's still not too late to run.

speaker: Phainon
line: No, I'm just thinking about the warriors who also braved this very corridor in the past. They all ventured towards the city of the Lance of Fury , all just to set their names in gold.

speaker: Phainon
line: The fortress may be in ruins now, but what we're about to do is no different from what they were striving for back then.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go. We'll take back the Coreflame of Strife or die in Kremnos.

speaker: Phainon
line: Those are the only two paths to glory we can choose from.

speaker: Phainon
line: How does it feel to be home again after so long?

speaker: Mydei
line: Not here. I lived in the inner city.

speaker: Phainon
line: Oh... As befitting of the crown prince of Kremnos .

speaker: Phainon
line: Trianne, the road ahead is dangerous. You should stay here and find a safe place to hide.

speaker: Phainon
line: We'll return once we complete our mission. Then we'll have to trouble you to use the Century Gate again, alright?

speaker: Trianne
line: Got it. Hide so the baddies can't find me!

text: She still looks and acts just like a child.

speaker: Phainon
line: Trianne has sacrificed a lot for Amphoreus .

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ By the way, aren't you going to tell (Trailblazer) any stories about Castrum Kremnos? Aren't you worried I'll tell ( him / her ) all the historical myths you despise?

speaker: Mydei
line: I'd like to see you try.

speaker: Phainon
line: *sigh* It's exhausting talking to you sometimes...

speaker: Phainon
line: Castrum Kremnos has been Nikador 's territory since ancient times. It's a massive moving fortress that surrounds the Titan , built by their followers.

speaker: Phainon
line: In the age before the Lance of Fury fell from grace, Castrum Kremnos would follow the Lance into battle after battle. It's a city that enforces strict discipline and reveres military might.

speaker: Phainon
line: Compared to that, the customs of my home feel very unsophisticated.

speaker: Mydei
line: There. Once we pass through that gate, we'll be in the acropolis.

speaker: Phainon
line: We'll finally see some soldiers roaming about.

speaker: Mydei
line: They're minions who've succumbed to depravity. Smashing them to pieces would be the greatest mercy.

speaker: Phainon
line: It seems enemies aren't the only things stopping us. This bridge has fallen into disrepair. I suppose even Kremnoan craftsmanship can be unreliable sometimes.

speaker: Mydei
line: Sorry to disappoint, but the outer city was built by convicts.

speaker: Phainon
line: No wonder it's so fragile. Maybe these people were taking their grievances out on you.

speaker: Mydei
line: Doesn't matter. There's no shame in resistance here, whether it's from an adversary or a convict on death row.

speaker: Phainon
line: Except now, it's stopping the people trying to kill Nikador . It's moments like this that make me miss Tribbie 's power.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Learning and mastering are two different concepts. Without a priest's resonance, an ordinary person would fall into a coma after chanting the first few words of the prayer.

children.text: Lucky for you, I'm not an ordinary person.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Oh? Tribbie taught you how?

text: Lucky for you, I'm an expert.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Oh? Tribbie taught you how?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I have to say that the ability to perform miracles is innate. Without a priest's resonance, an ordinary person would fall into a coma after chanting the first few words of the prayer.

speaker: Phainon
line: But since you've volunteered, please be my guest.

text: Oronyx's Prayer can be used to temporarily rewind the collapsed floating bridge to its levitating state. Oronyx's Prayer can be used to temporarily rewind the collapsed floating bridge to its levitating state. The rewound floating bridge can only be crossed once before it collapses again. Additionally, the bridge is powered by crystals below it, and impacting the crystals will also cause the bridge to collapse . Each bridge may have a unique means to collapse. The rewound floating bridge can only be crossed once before it collapses again. Additionally, the bridge is powered by crystals below it, and impacting the crystals will also cause the bridge to collapse . Each bridge may have a unique means to collapse. When the Trailblazer themself is standing atop the unstable bridge, they will not be able to activate the prayer to rewind the bridge. When the Trailblazer themself is standing atop the unstable bridge, they will not be able to activate the prayer to rewind the bridge.

speaker: Phainon
line: Amazing! You do have the touch!

speaker: Phainon
line: And it's broken again... I guess even a Titan's power isn't enough to stabilize this bridge.

speaker: Mydei
line: Just like the soul of a criminal: fragile.

text: (After interacting with the switch near the gate)

speaker: Phainon
line: Look, the gate openedâ€”

speaker: Mydei
line: Genius. We never would have known if you hadn't said anything.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go. We can take a detour from the broken bridge.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go. We can take a detour from the broken bridge.

speaker: Phainon
line: Look, in the sky! That's...

speaker: Mydei
line: The Blade of Fury â€” Even if the world lay shattered, it would still hang high above everyone's heads.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's magnificent...

speaker: Mydei
line: You haven't seen it at its most magnificent.

speaker: Mydei
line: That's the giant sword Nikador used to destroy Aquila 's heavenly kingdom long ago, followed by one city-state after another.

speaker: Mydei
line: It's not just a weapon, it's the faith of the Kremnoan people. Souls who died heroically on the battlefield will further temper the blade in Nikador's hand, becoming a part of the god-king's power.

speaker: Mydei
line: Such is the Titan's conquest â€” Nikador , the Titankin, and the people who have faith in Strife sweep away all their enemies. Even in death, they embrace eternal glory.

speaker: Phainon
line: I think you're exaggerating a little. I can think of at least three losses suffered by Castrum Kremnos in the Chrysos War , just off the top of my head.

speaker: Mydei
line: There's no shame in losing to those who conspire and plot in secret. Those weak and despicable individuals are the ones who should be ashamed.

speaker: Phainon
line: True. Valorous Death Before Glorious Return. The Kremnoan people have always been straightforward. They spend their whole lives running to the battlefield. No wonder Zagreus loves teasing you.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...But that's all in the past.

speaker: Phainon
line: Guess what I'm thinking, Mydei?

speaker: Mydei
line: Probably nothing good. Keep it simple.

speaker: Phainon
line: This isn't just an expedition. It's also a battle to determine a victor. Since we're already here, why don't we have a match and fight to our heart's content?

speaker: Phainon
line: Just you and me. Let's recreate the original Kremnos Festival .

speaker: Phainon
line: Show me what the grandest fighting competition in Castrum Kremnos was like. Let's gild this expedition with another layer of glory and compete to see who can kill the most crazed Titankin . How about it?

speaker: Mydei
line: What's the prize?

speaker: Phainon
line: The privilege of delivering the final blow to Nikador .

speaker: Mydei
line: Interesting. I accept your challenge.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ I know Mydei. He prefers to fight alone. There are two paths ahead. (Trailblazer) and I will take the same one.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ We won't compete on who's fastest but on the number of trophies, so we'll each be responsible for our own tally. Don't worry. I won't add ( his / her ) kills to my own count.

speaker: Mydei
line: Doesn't matter to me even if you do.

speaker: Mydei
line: You don't know the lay of the land, so I'll give you a ten-step head start.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ Haha! He already thinks he's won, but I won't decline the offer either. Let's get going, (Trailblazer)!

text: Go to the temple at the left

title: Step Description
content: In this war-torn land, the twoChrysos Heirs, Phainon and Mydei, agreed on a spontaneous competition. They split into two paths, each eliminating enemies on the way to Castrum Kremnos. Traps and dangers lurked around every corner in the city, demanding that one proceed with utmost caution.

speaker: Mydei
line: Why are you still standing there?

speaker: Phainon
line: Returning the favor. Ten steps are too many, you can have one back.

text: Continue onward deep into Castrum Kremnos

speaker: Phainon
line: Made it! Hopefully the enemies on this side are worthy of our combined might.

speaker: Phainon
line: Finally, opponents who look like they can put up a fight.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go! We're going to win this competition!

text:
(Begin battle againstFuriae ArcherÃ—3,Furiae WarriorÃ—1)
(Wave 2:Furiae WarriorÃ—2,Furiae ArcherÃ—2,Furiae PhilosopherÃ—1)
You and Phainon defeated 4 Titankins together, and you collected Kremnos crests from their bodies...

speaker: Phainon
line: That's two down. Not a bad start.

text: Not great at math, are you?

speaker: Phainon
line: We fought them together, so naturally I can only take half the credit. That's what I call fair play.

text: Isn't it more dangerous to split up?

speaker: Phainon
line: Don't worry. Mydei is strong, and so am I.

speaker: Phainon
line: Did you see the look in his eyes? He's wracked by homesickness and doesn't want to show it to anyone else.

speaker: Phainon
line: Nothing is more important to Mydei than his people and glory. The city may be in ruins, but... Kremnos is still the only place where he can be free.

speaker: Phainon
line: Now that we've sent him away, he can go have a good cry wherever he wants.

text: So, you two are actually really close.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: He's both my friend and my foe. It's always been this way. Working with him always brings out my competitive side.

text: The way you cared... I'm literally in tears...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: We've been both friends and foes since the day we met. Working with him always brings out my competitive side.

speaker: Mydei
line: Why are you just standing there? Giving up already?

speaker: Phainon
line: What do you know? We're talking strategy here!

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ Let's go, (Trailblazer). The competition might not be the real goal, but I still really hate losing.

speaker: Phainon
line: Whoa... That's impressive.

speaker: Phainon
line: Following an iron chain, onto the path leading to the giant sword on the other side? This is more like it!

text: The Kremnoan follows you with his eagle-sharp gaze. You're sure he can keep his eyes open day and night without blinking.

speaker: Phainon
line: Huh? When did you get over there?

speaker: Mydei
line: I told you before that you don't know the lay of the land in this city. That's why you won't beat me.

speaker: Mydei
line: And just so you know: I'm at six.

speaker: Phainon
line: Wow, seems like luck is on your side. Our path was a little lax on security. Not to worry though, I'll catch up once we cross this iron chain bridge.

speaker: Mydei
line: Assuming you can get across. Do you see the lightning bolts striking the chain?

speaker: Phainon
line: It doesn't look like ordinary lightning, which means mindlessly running across would spell certain death.

speaker: Phainon
line: There happens to be a Prophecy Tablet here though. Let's go take a look. Maybe it'll help us.

text: Use the Prophecy Tablet to shut the thunderbolt

speaker: Phainon
line: Best keep a safe distance from that chain until we find a way to get rid of the lightning.

text: The Prophecy Tablet is a creation of Oronyx. Solving the puzzle will make the prophecy come true The Prophecy Tablet is a creation of Oronyx. Solving the puzzle will make the prophecy come true Combine the fragments in the operation area to match the pattern on the left and align with the base image in the operation area. The overlapping parts of the fragments will disappear , but if you overlay the fragments again, they will reappear. Combine the fragments in the operation area to match the pattern on the left and align with the base image in the operation area. The overlapping parts of the fragments will disappear , but if you overlay the fragments again, they will reappear. If the puzzle remains unsolved for a period of time, assistance from the Tablet itself can be sought. ( Click Click on PC / Tap Tap on mobile / Press Press on Controller ) the hint button, then ( click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller ) any fragment again to view the hint If the puzzle remains unsolved for a period of time, assistance from the Tablet itself can be sought. ( Click Click on PC / Tap Tap on mobile / Press Press on Controller ) the hint button, then ( click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller ) any fragment again to view the hint

speaker: Phainon
line: Great. Should be smooth sailing from here.

speaker: Phainon
line: How's it going? You look stumped. I'll be going on ahead though.

speaker: Mydei
line: Mere lightning won't stop a warrior of Castrum Kremnos.

text: Cross the chain bridge to the other side

speaker: Phainon
line: Whoa! You're nimbler than I thought!

speaker: Mydei
line: Worry about yourself. There's an endless abyss below us.

speaker: Mydei
line: â€”That's more like it!

speaker: Phainon
line: You practically have nine lives and, on top of that, you're lucky? I'm almost jealous.

speaker: Phainon
line: Whew... That was a close one. Thankfully we both have a remarkable sense of balance.

text: Investigate the safe zone to collect information

speaker: Phainon
line: So, this is a lounge? It feels out of place.

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe this is where all the warriors in the past took their breaks during competitions.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ Wait, (Trailblazer), don't leave yet. My intuition tells me this room is still hiding a secret.

speaker: Phainon
line: Why don't we keep searching? I get especially lucky when I'm with you. Maybe we'll find some hero's lost treasures.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hm... Just regular old bits and pieces. Nothing that stands out.

speaker: Phainon
line: There's a thick layer of dust. Guess no one's been here for a long time. They must have been left behind by Mydei's people when they departed.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You've likely seen them in Okhema , but it's hard to tell just by appearance.

text: It's hard to imagine people used to live here...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It was a city of warriors, but ordinary citizens lived here too.

speaker: Phainon
line: They look the same as anyone else. They just have traditions that are slightly... different from ours.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's a gadget that records your voice. People don't like this sort of thing nowadays.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ Why don't you hold on to it, (Trailblazer)? It makes a sound when you shake it. Should make for an interesting collectible.

speaker: Phainon
line: Give you something to show for your trip, in addition to the photos.

children.text: Lance of Fury, Nikador. Blades and lances resound out loud, and their bloodlust will never die. The peace that they protect lays beneath the horrific mountains of corpses and rivers of blood.

speaker: Phainon
line: This is... a Proverb Slate?

speaker: Phainon
line: It doesn't look like the rest of the things that were left behind. It looks kind of new, in fact. Who could have left this here?

speaker: Phainon
line: I can't read the runes either. It must be written in an ancient language of Castrum Kremnos.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: There you go.

text: It's time to use the Synesthesia Beacon .

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: What does that mean? Alright, give it a go.

speaker: Phainon
line: Don't worry. We have an expert next door. We can show it to Mydei when we group back up.

speaker: Phainon
line: Though that does remind me: I've been wondering how you can understand the language and writing we use in Amphoreus when you're from beyond the sky.

text: Maybe Amphoreus isn't that isolated after all.
Dan Heng and I haven't figured that out yet either.

speaker: Phainon
line: Did Amphoreus have more dealings with worlds beyond the sky than we thought? But nothing like this was ever recorded in our historical materials.

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe your arrival will overturn many things we thought we knew.

text: Continue onward deep into Castrum Kremnos

speaker: Phainon
line: Well, we've turned over every nook and cranny. It's time to move on.

text: (Enter the room at the end of the hallway)

speaker: Phainon
line: Wait... What's that creature doing? Is it trying to stop us?

speaker: Phainon
line: It even killed its own comrade... They truly have no honor to speak of.

text: The Ball-Holder Statue's base can be destroyed by attacks , causing the ball to roll in the direction the statue faces, breaking obstacles along its path, and pushing open slightly ajar doors. The Ball-Holder Statue's base can be destroyed by attacks , causing the ball to roll in the direction the statue faces, breaking obstacles along its path, and pushing open slightly ajar doors. Oronyx's Prayer can be used to rewind the Ball-Holder Statue to when its base is undamaged. Oronyx's Prayer can be used to rewind the Ball-Holder Statue to when its base is undamaged.

speaker: Phainon
line: The road ahead is blocked by the iron ball...

speaker: Phainon
line: Can you call upon Oronyx 's Miracle again?

speaker: Phainon
line: No, that's not going to work.

text: Sorry, it's because I'm too weak...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It's not your fault. Castrum Kremnos is Nikador's territory, after all. The environment is cutting off your ability to resonate with Oronyx .

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It really isn't. Castrum Kremnos is Nikador's territory, after all. The environment is cutting off your ability to resonate with Oronyx .

speaker: Phainon
line: In principle, there should be an instrument used by Time Priests somewhere in this fortress... Aha, there it is.

speaker: Phainon
line: What did I tell you? I get especially lucky when I'm with you. This instrument stabilizes the connection between priests and the Three Titans of Fate. Give it a try.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Relax. If something should happen to you, "I'll be sure to pass on your last words to Dan Heng, my friend!"

text: If something should happen to me...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: "I'll be sure to pass on your last words to Dan Heng, my friend!"

speaker: Phainon
line: Don't worry. You'll be just fine.

text: Interacting with Oronyx's Shrine summons the Realm of the Ages. Within this realm, the color of the energy ripples on memory-laden objects changes , indicating that the Trailblazer's rewinding ability is now unrestricted. Interacting with Oronyx's Shrine summons the Realm of the Ages. Within this realm, the color of the energy ripples on memory-laden objects changes , indicating that the Trailblazer's rewinding ability is now unrestricted. Within the realm, a single ( click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller ) is sufficient to continuously complete the entire rewinding process, with no three-second time limit . Additionally, pressing the rewind button again during rewinding on the same target temporarily interrupts the process. Within the realm, a single ( click click on PC / tap tap on mobile / press press on Controller ) is sufficient to continuously complete the entire rewinding process, with no three-second time limit . Additionally, pressing the rewind button again during rewinding on the same target temporarily interrupts the process. You can evaluate whether the realm has been activated by looking out for the presence of a floating ball of light near the Trailblazer. The realm will dissipate when you are a certain distance away from the shrine, and the boost for your Rewind powers will also disappear. You can evaluate whether the realm has been activated by looking out for the presence of a floating ball of light near the Trailblazer. The realm will dissipate when you are a certain distance away from the shrine, and the boost for your Rewind powers will also disappear.

speaker: Phainon
line: Not bad. Something feels different about you already.

speaker: Phainon
line: Why don't you give it another go?

speaker: Phainon
line: That's it! Nice work.

text: (Continue down the hall into the main area)

speaker: Phainon
line: From the sound of things, we're about to lose if we don't step it up.

speaker: Phainon
line: Careful. We're getting very close to the Blade of Fury...

speaker: Phainon
line: This is the center all right. That's a sizable formation.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: In other words, this is our chance to overtake Mydei.

text: Now there's a chance to take the lead!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: My thoughts exactly. You have the heart of a fighter, my friend.

speaker: Phainon
line: If the records are correct, directly beneath the Blade of Fury lies the world-renowned Kremnos Arena . The path before us leads either to glory or to death...

speaker: Phainon
line: Of course, glory is ours, and death is theirs!

speaker: Phainon
line: "Approaching now are the duo of gladiators whose names strike terror in all who hear them â€” the one and only Dark Swordmaster, Phainon!"

speaker: Trailblazer
line: â–¶ "And the Galactic Baseballer!"

speaker: Phainon
line: "What a savage hit! The Baseballer shows no mercy to their enemies. Can you hear that? The crowd's roaring in approval!"

speaker: Trailblazer
line: â–¶ "Hmm... This requires a bit of imagination."

speaker: Phainon
line: "What marvelous teamwork! These two gladiators..."

speaker: Mydei
line: These delusions of yours are seriously getting on my nerves!

speaker: Phainon
line: "...must also contend with the noise from outside the arena. How unfortunate!"

speaker: Phainon
line: "With their exceptional strength and perfect teamwork, these two gladiators have bested every opponent..."

speaker: Mydei
line: "...but the glory they've been striving for has not come as anticipated."

speaker: Phainon
line: How disappointing â€” no sign of the Titan at all. Is Nikador hiding somewhere?

speaker: Mydei
line: They're most likely in the Soul-Forging Zone.

speaker: Mydei
line: The path is right behind you.

speaker: Phainon
line: Thanks. What about you?

speaker: Mydei
line: I'll take the other path. It's crawling with parasites.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ You've definitely had the upper hand in this competition. (Trailblazer), shall we go?

speaker: Phainon
line: Well, it's not every day you see a view like this. Go ahead and capture it with the photostone.

text: She is likely not interested in such scenery.
I'll take a photo of it then.
Help March 7th take a picture as a keepsake
A faint murmur rides the wind â€” a whisper of ancient history, the elegy of God...

speaker: Phainon
line: So, that friend of yours... her name is "March"?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: March 7th... and you think our names sound strange?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You guys mentioned her in the Vortex of Genesis earlier.

text: Did we mention her to you before?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You guys mentioned her in the Vortex of Genesis earlier.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I must say, her name is pretty unconventional, wouldn't you agree?

speaker: Phainon
line: You must really value your friendship with her to go through all this effort to document the journey for her.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Yeah, I can tell.

text: She was supposed to be here, but she's not feeling well.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Ah, that's unfortunate.

speaker: Phainon
line: Honestly, seeing how you both look out for your friend has furthered my trust in you.

speaker: Phainon
line: A person's true character often comes to light in their friendships. Most of what my teacher taught me has slipped away, but this sentence is still vivid in my memory.

speaker: Phainon
line: Especially in these tumultuous times, friends who you can trust completely are a rare and precious find.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's keep going. We can't let Mydeimos get too full of himself. The Prophecy Tablet might be able to unlock that closed gate.

text: Use the Prophecy Tablet to open the door

speaker: Phainon
line: There, all done! Let's move on.

text: Continue onward deep into Castrum Kremnos

speaker: Phainon
line: According to Mydei, we need to go deeper into Castrum Kremnos. It's that way.

speaker: Phainon
line: But there's another exit here. I wonder where it leads.

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe we can use the iron ball to smash through the roadblock. Hopefully, it leads to Castrum Kremnos's treasure vault. Otherwise, it might not be worth the effort.

speaker: Phainon
line: There's one upstairs. Maybe we can figure out a way to get it down.

speaker: Phainon
line: Choose any path you like. It's entirely up to you.

text: Solve the mechanism of the room and continue your exploration

speaker: Phainon
line: Blocked path? That won't stop us!

text: (Some dialogue was removed from this section inVersion 3.2.)
Continue onward deep into Castrum Kremnos

speaker: Phainon
line: Well done! Go claim our rewards â€” no one else in Kremnos will have any use for them anyway.

speaker: Phainon
line: A fallen Titan, soulless kin, and a desolate fortress...

speaker: Phainon
line: This place has fallen pretty far from the way people remember it.

text: (Continue through the second door, onto the bridge)

speaker: Phainon
line: We meet again! What's your count so far?

speaker: Mydei
line: Thirty.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's not too far off. We still stand a chance.

speaker: Phainon
line: I just remembered â€” we came across a slate with inscriptions in an ancient language of Castrum Kremnos. Could you help translate it?

speaker: Mydei
line: Is it beyond your knowledge, amateur historian?

speaker: Phainon
line: Sadly, yes. You are my only hope now.

speaker: Mydei
line: You just keep having fun. I've got better things to do.

speaker: Phainon
line: There's another mural up ahead. Want to take a closer look?

speaker: Phainon
line: Looks like they're creating Titankin. Maybe this is what "Soul-Forging" means?

speaker: Phainon
line: Crafting a body from rough stones and then infusing it with a god's golden blood to bring it to life...

speaker: Phainon
line: No wonder Castrum Kremnos keeps winning battle after battle. With this method, they can create as many soldiers as they want...

speaker: Phainon
line: How did you beat us here again? But there are still plenty of enemies around. What's wrong? Already tired?

speaker: Mydei
line: I gave you two this final chance on purpose. If you're not interested, fine.

speaker: Phainon
line: Well, how generous of you. This is the Stockpiling Zone â€” we must be getting close to Nikador .

speaker: Mydei
line: That's right. But by the time you arrive, he might already have fallen by my hand.

speaker: Phainon
line: Then we must act quickly. We can't let you die right before our eyes, can we?

speaker: Phainon
line: We'll be meeting up with Mydei soon. Want to clean up this area and increase our trophy count?

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ Victory or defeat, it all comes down to this, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Phainon
line: The path is cut off. But how did he get through? Did... he set up this roadblock on purpose?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: He might look honest, but he's a lot shrewder than he seems.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: He might look honest, but he's a lot shrewder than he seems.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hold your horses! We're not exactly immortal here.

speaker: Phainon
line: Enough joking. Let's look around...

speaker: Phainon
line: This might come in handy â€” the stone table for the Hand of Zagreus . Let's use it to fill the crack in the path.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Simply put, Zagreus is the Titan of trickery â€” thievery, deception, and betrayal, these unsavory acts are all tied to them.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: That Titan has fallen, but they left "Bewitching Hands" scattered all over the world. Now, people use these giant hands to move things around â€” and, well, to steal things, too.

text: Let's get a move on. I'll stop with the questions.

speaker: Phainon
line: I don't normally approve of this, but given the circumstances, let's use it this one time.

text: Hand of Zagreus is the divine body left behind by Zagreus, the Trickery Titan. After the Titan had fallen, the people of Amphoreus learned to modify and utilize them. Hand of Zagreus is the divine body left behind by Zagreus, the Trickery Titan. After the Titan had fallen, the people of Amphoreus learned to modify and utilize them. Interact with the stone control platform to control the Hand of Zagreus. Interact with the stone control platform to control the Hand of Zagreus. Use the directional buttons to control the movement and the right buttons to control its elevation. Hit the Quit button to disengage. The Hand of Zagreus will remain at the spot . Use the directional buttons to control the movement and the right buttons to control its elevation. Hit the Quit button to disengage. The Hand of Zagreus will remain at the spot .

speaker: Phainon
line: We need to find a solution to mend the broken path.

text: While controlling the Hand of Zagreus, interact with the golden Zagreus rune to perform a Bridge Action , forming a bridge where the rune is located to provide passage to the Trailblazer . While controlling the Hand of Zagreus, interact with the golden Zagreus rune to perform a Bridge Action , forming a bridge where the rune is located to provide passage to the Trailblazer .

speaker: Phainon
line: Flawless work. Great job!

text: (Some dialogue was removed from this section inVersion 3.2.)

speaker: Phainon
line: So many stones here. I wonder how many war machines can be built with all this?

speaker: Phainon
line: But after today, they'll be slumbering here forever.

text: (After turning the corner in the hallway)

speaker: Phainon
line: Look, someone's getting impatient.

speaker: Mydei
line: You took your sweet time.

speaker: Phainon
line: Apologies, but someone forgot to clear out the obstacles along the way.

speaker: Mydei
line: Enough chatter. Show me your tally.

text: Mydei displays the thirty Castrum Kremnos crests in his collection.
Compare the total number of crests you obtained with Mydei's...
(If the player collected more than 30 Castrum Kremnos crests)

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Aha! Looks like we won!

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Well, I'm a man of my word. You can deliver the final blow.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Wait... On second thought, the stakes seem a bit too high. Deciding who gets the glory with just one competition might be disrespectful to the gods.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Let's change the stakes. You can just share half of your spoils with us. As for Nikador , we can take him down together.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: ...The real question is if we can pull it off.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Well, here's your spoils.

text: (If the player collected less than 30 Castrum Kremnos crests)

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ...Looks like I could work on my skills a bit more.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Well, I'm a man of my word. You can deliver the final blow to Nikador .

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Giving away the glory of delivering the final blow that easily? I thought you were a real warrior.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I guess being the crown prince of Kremnos makes you obsessed with all this ceremonial stuff.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Deciding who gets the glory with just one competition might be disrespectful to the gods. Let us declare no victor and continue onâ€”

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Nikador 's soul should be claimed by true warriors.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Surprisingly, your words can sometimes be music to my ears.

text: (If the player collected exactly 30 Castrum Kremnos crests)

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It's a tie. Funny how things work out, huh?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: In that case, how about we deliver the final blow to Nikador together? What do you say?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Since there is no victor, let's continue onâ€”

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Nikador 's soul should be claimed by true warriors.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Haha, it's settled then. Let's divide the glory equally.

speaker: Phainon
line: They're right up ahead, then?

speaker: Mydei
line: There's just a faint scent, but I'm certain they're here. We're about to cross paths with Strife.

text: Continue onward deep into Castrum Kremnos

speaker: Phainon
line: Wow, look at this big guy. Could this be Verax Leo ?

speaker: Mydei
line: Show some respect. This is Chryseus Leo , not some rumor-spouting gossip-monger.

speaker: Mydei
line: Chryseus Leo was the top advisor in Castrum Kremnos, whose wise counsel helped my tribe win many battles and thwart numerous schemes.

speaker: Mydei
line: Sadly, he has lost his voice now. If only the Chrysos Heirs could benefit from his wisdomâ€”

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Mâ€”Mydeimos...

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Crown... prince?

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Leo?

speaker: Mydei
line: After all these years, you're still awake?

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Mâ€”Mydeimos...

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: I could never... forget your voice. I've been waiting for this moment... all along.

speaker: Mydei
line: Please, teacher, share your wise counsel with me!

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Crown prince... Castrum Kremnos has lost everything â€” its people, traditions... and most importantly, its glory.

speaker: Mydei
line: To survive, our people have migrated, and our traditions have faded with time. But glory? Even though it has vanished into the mist and its walls have crumbled, Castrum Kremnos has never forsaken the glory of its warriors. Why say otherwise?

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: Our god has completely lost their sanity. No longer a revered symbol of war, they have fallen and are now plotting an evil scheme...

speaker: Chryseus Leo
line: I urge you, Mydeimos, to put an end to their endless suffering. Allow them to die as a warrior! They must... go with honor...

speaker: Mydei
line: Teacher?

speaker: Mydei
line: Teacher, answer me! As your crown prince, I command youâ€”

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Mydei.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let him rest. He must be exhausted.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Perhaps those were just the delirious words of a dying lion. I shouldn't overthink it. Let's keep going.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hold on. This is the slate that I mentioned earlier. We couldn't decipher it.

speaker: Phainon
line: Maybe it's connected to the scheme the old lion mentioned.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hand it to me.

children.text: ...The black tide may be an indescribable enemy, but if exploited carefully, it can also become a sharp weapon pointed at our archenemy. Infiltrators can be instructed to transport a load of tainted Titankin covered in special earth, so that they may be smuggled among dromas caravan goods into Okhema. Upon entry, under the cover of the Curtain-Fall Hour, the personnel will stash the kin in various sections of the city. After a few days, the earth will weather and peel, suffocating the streets of Okhema with Titankin's tainted air. When this moment arrives, the Okhemans will be frantically searching for the source of the pollution. We just have to wait for the chaos to unfurl to take the final step to victory: Gather the heroic souls within the city, let the divine blade of wrath point at Okhema, and run Strife's blade through the entire city â€” after which, our forces will overwhelm them like an ocean wave crashing into them, and the long-awaited victory will finally fall into our grasp.

speaker: Mydei
line: No... Nikador would never...

speaker: Phainon
line: That explains the surprise attack on Okhema. I didn't think that the mad Titan could have orchestrated it...

speaker: Mydei
line: Okhema is on the brink of destruction. Someone needs to go back and rescue them.

speaker: Phainon
line: Nâ€”No, we need to press on and finish our mission.

speaker: Mydei
line: Are you blinded by glory? As I said before, victory only lies in assembling a full-fledged army.

speaker: Phainon
line: We're just one step away from Nikador . Defeat the source of the evil, and the threat will vanish on its own.

speaker: Phainon
line: Just like that decisive strike, there is no turning back for us. Nikador could drive Okhema to the brink of ruin, but we can do the same to them.

speaker: Phainon
line: Besides, I have faith in Aglaea and Tribbie. With two demigods and our allies watching over Okhema, they should be more than capable of protecting the holy city.

text: We can't let our efforts go to waste.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Alright, I'll trust your judgment this time. Let's hope we don't end up in an abyss of regrets.

speaker: Mydei
line: Nikador ... Has your divine body truly been hollowed out by the hands of madness? Have you completely forsaken your dignity as a warrior?

title: Mission Description
content: Through Chryseus Leo, (Trailblazer) and the party learned that the maddened Nikador is planning a devastating attack on Okhema. With events taking this dire turn, their only option is to press forward and eliminate the source of this malevolence.

speaker: Mydei
line: The sweltering heat â€” the Titan's wrath has set the air ablaze.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yeah, we're getting pretty closeâ€”

speaker: Phainon
line: It's getting even hotter. Is this place still in use?

speaker: Mydei
line: After we pass through here, we'll reach the Soul-Forging Zone.

speaker: Phainon
line: The heat is unbearable, and all these thoughts are echoing in my head...

speaker: Phainon
line: On second thought, this could very well be where we meet our end, right?

speaker: Mydei
line: Be careful. Your thoughts are being corrupted by Strife.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ You're right. It was my decision to keep pushing forward. And with (Trailblazer) here, we're sure to complete our mission and return safely.

speaker: Phainon
line: Just like the path ahead, even though it's completely dilapidated, it will still lead us to our final destination.

text: (Approach the Hand of Zagreus control platform)

speaker: Mydei
line: Let me smash itâ€”

speaker: Phainon
line: Hold your horses! Don't waste your energy here â€” use your head.

speaker: Phainon
line: Looks like we'll need to use the hand again.

text: The Hand of Zagreus can be used for transportation. The Hand of Zagreus can be used for transportation. Transportable objects have a mark of transportation. Controlling the Hand of Zagreus to interact with transportable objects will cause it to perform a Grab Action and carry it within the hand. Additionally, when the Hand of Zagreus is carrying a transportable object, it cannot perform other gestures . Transportable objects have a mark of transportation. Controlling the Hand of Zagreus to interact with transportable objects will cause it to perform a Grab Action and carry it within the hand. Additionally, when the Hand of Zagreus is carrying a transportable object, it cannot perform other gestures . While the Hand of Zagreus is carrying a transportable object, placement spots with marks of placement can be seen. Interacting with the placement spots while carrying a transportable object will place it at the corresponding location. While the Hand of Zagreus is carrying a transportable object, placement spots with marks of placement can be seen. Interacting with the placement spots while carrying a transportable object will place it at the corresponding location.

speaker: Phainon
line: Look out! An enemy!

speaker: Mydei
line: Put your sword away... It seems to still be rational.

speaker: Mydei
line: We might be able to get some clues from it.

speaker: Sculpting Zone Strong Man
line: All hail Nikador , my master and guide.

speaker: Sculpting Zone Strong Man
line: Immortal soul of war, ever by my side.

speaker: Mydei
line: Titankin, let me ask you this: Is Castrum Kremnos planning to destroy Okhema?

text: You don't beat around the bush, do you?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: What do you propose? I'm all ears.

text: This might be above its pay grade.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: There aren't any other options.

speaker: Sculpting Zone Strong Man
line: All hail Nikador , my master and guide.

speaker: Sculpting Zone Strong Man
line: Immortal soul of war, ever by my side.

speaker: Phainon
line: It is indeed rational, but just barely.

speaker: Mydei
line: "Immortal soul of war"...

speaker: Mydei
line: Let's keep going. There might be other Titankin nearby we can talk to.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aren't you going to "take care" of it?

speaker: Mydei
line: If you see it as a threat, go ahead. I have no reason to do it.

text: (Kill the Sculpting Zone Strong Man, optional)

speaker: Mydei
line: Your ruthlessness is akin to that of the executioners in Castrum Kremnos.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let me translate that for you... Actually, I'm not sure what it means either.

text: Continue to search for and talk with other Titankin

speaker: Sculpting Zone Scholar
line: Sculpt an indestructible body with steel that never rusts.

speaker: Sculpting Zone Scholar
line: The all-powerful Nikador , ruler of all lands. The all-divine Nikador , bringer of a thousand fears.

speaker: Phainon
line: "An indestructible body"...

speaker: Phainon
line: The Nikador that attacked Okhema was only a double. Considering what the Titankin said, could there be more of them in Castrum Kremnos?

speaker: Mydei
line: By the end of the war, Nikador had succumbed to madness, and their divine power dwindled. Now, the Titan's remaining strength is less than a tenth of what it once was.

speaker: Mydei
line: Creating doubles for themself [ sic ] might have stabilized their power, but instead of a glorious death, they chose to drag out their miserable existence. How tragic.

speaker: Phainon
line: They seem to have forfeited all their dignity as a warrior. Leading your people away from here was the right choice, Mydei.

speaker: Mydei
line: There's no need to glorify my choice, Deliverer. It was just a self-imposed exile that cost me my pride. Not something worth celebrating in a song.

speaker: Mydei
line: But if the Titankin's words are true, going up against Nikador is destined to be a bitter fight.

speaker: Phainon
line: Speaking of indestructible bodies, you're quite the expert in that area yourself.

speaker: Mydei
line: You talk too much.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ (Trailblazer), did I ever tell you? The Chrysos Heirs are all endowed with unique powers.

speaker: Phainon
line: Legend has it that Mydei, the invincible crown prince of Kremnos, has a talent for "defying death."

speaker: Sculpting Zone Supervisor
line: Martyrs, consecrate your souls of war for the Lance of Fury ...

speaker: Sculpting Zone Supervisor
line: You shall become Nikador 's blade... to pierce through the enemy's heart and core...

speaker: Sculpting Zone Supervisor
line: You shall be the timber to nourish the Coreflame... to reduce the decayed world to ashes...

speaker: Phainon
line: "Reduce the decayed world to ashes"? With nefarious schemes?

speaker: Mydei
line: They've been twisted by madness, just like Castrum Kremnos. They remember how to kill, but they've forgotten why.

speaker: Phainon
line: I've always believed that killing with blades isn't any nobler than killing with subterfuge.

speaker: Phainon
line: Aside from one's mission and survival, no other reason can justify violence.

speaker: Mydei
line: That's where we differ. For my tribe, glory and conquest are also valid reasons.

speaker: Phainon
line: But deep down, you don't really agree with that, do you?

speaker: Sculpting Zone Supervisor
line: Martyrs...

speaker: Phainon
line: Hmm? Was it facing us the whole time?

text: Isn't it kind of cute how slowly it speaks?

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Ready your arms!

speaker: Sculpting Zone Supervisor
line: For the Lance of Fury ...

speaker: Sculpting Zone Supervisor
line: Consecrate your souls of war!

speaker: Phainon
line: I've given up on figuring out the logic of these minions. They're just pure chaos.

speaker: Mydei
line: No matter. You and I will soon bring this madness to a close.

speaker: Mydei
line: Are you ready, Deliverer?

speaker: Phainon
line: Always. Bearing the Coreflame of Strife... has been my deep-seated desire.

text: Go and meet Nikador, Lance of Fury!

speaker: Phainon
line: We're so close to the fall of a Titan... It feels unreal.

speaker: Mydei
line: Don't think of them as a god. It's just you, me, and them â€” warriors in a fight to the death.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ That oppressive feeling from earlier â€” it's back. Do you feel it, (Trailblazer)?

speaker: Phainon
line: But that bluster is no longer pure. It's mingled with the scent of blood and the cries of lost souls...

speaker: Phainon
line: The fate I've been hoping for... lies behind this door.

text: (Approach the marked location, through the double doors)

speaker: Mydei
line: Remember, you insisted that we come here. Now, show us that cursed resolve!

speaker: Phainon
line: But how can I pretend that this is just an ordinary battle?

speaker: Phainon
line: My mission and purpose... all depend on this. Can you forget the suffering of your people and your corroded homeland?

speaker: Mydei
line: Never! But I've learned a method you probably wouldn't understand.

speaker: Mydei
line: All the anger and regret I feel right now, I've learned to control them and hone them into a razor-sharp weapon for my use...

speaker: Mydei
line: It has a simple name: Intent to kill.

speaker: Phainon
line: You really are a beast.

speaker: Phainon
line: But right now, perhaps it's best for us to submit to the beasts inside.

speaker: Mydei
line: Corrupted god! Face me and meet your doom!

speaker: Mydei
line: I am a son of Kremnos and a Chrysos Heir of the prophecy, and I now offer you the fairest dealâ€”

speaker: Mydei
line: I trade a thousand scars and a hundred lives of mine for your glorious death!

text: (Begin battle againstSavage God, Mad King, Incarnation of Strife)

speaker: Phainon
line: Mydei, I may not be able to fight like you...

speaker: Phainon
line: But I will do battle in my own way and bring down this god!

text: (After the "War Armor" is destroyed or Weakness is broken)

speaker: Phainon
line: Stop hiding behind those pathetic doubles! We'll crush you!

speaker: Mydei
line: Finally ready to reveal your true self, Titan?

speaker: Mydei
line: Feel the wrath of humanity, corrupted god!

text: (When Savage God, Mad King, Incarnation of Strife is reduced to 40% HP)

speaker: Phainon
line: They're already near their end!

speaker: Phainon
line: Shatter the armor of Strife and strip away the Coreflame!

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Immortal wretch... how amusing.

speaker: Phainon
line: The souls of war are amassing in the skies above Kremnos... surging toward the Blade of Fury!

speaker: Phainon
line: They have no intention of winning the fight. Instead, they're using death after death to temper their blade... Even with a hundred deaths, they've resolved to pierce through Kephale 's body!

speaker: Mydei
line: All their honor is gone... How did the god of our tribe fall so low?

speaker: Mydei
line: Deliverer, here is your moment.

speaker: Mydei
line: I'll hold them off here and keep them from wielding the Blade of Fury. You need to head back and notify the two demigods.

speaker: Phainon
line: â–¶ Are you out of your mind, facing the Titan alone? I'm staying too. (Trailblazer), pleaseâ€”

speaker: Mydei
line: Get lost! Do you have to make me say this?

speaker: Mydei
line: I must stay here, not for Okhema's safety, but to settle the score with my god.

speaker: Mydei
line: Even if immortality is a curse, it shouldn't be used so despicably.

speaker: Mydei
line: Go, Deliverer. Your battlefield lies elsewhere.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Stay strong. Try not to get killed too many times.

speaker: Mydei
line: Finally, some peace.

speaker: Mydei
line: You and I â€” two warriors rejected by death. Is there any contest more fair than this?

speaker: Mydei
line: Come forth! The king who has never claimed his throne, against the god who has fallen from grace. How perfectly matched we are!

speaker: Mydei
line: Let's battle till the world's final breath!

text: You and Phainon retreat using the opportunity and return to Okhema...
Mydei and Nikador's battle cries can be heard from beyond the crumbling walls... Don't let Mydei's desperate struggle be in vain. Hurry up and uncover Nikador's secrets as fast as you can.
